title: Longfellow House Washington's Headquarters National Historic Site: Park Newspaper
body: Longfellow House Bulletin       The Longfellow House Bulletin documents the National Park Service's stewardship of the house and the efforts of the Friends of the Longfellow House to support and supplement this work. Every issue contains articles on aspects of the house's collections, research on Longfellow related topics, and a profile of someone involved with the Longfellow House, whether as a "Friend", scholar, staff member, or other interested person. The Bulletin is a collaborative endeavor between the Friends of the Longfellow House and Longfellow House - Washington's Headquarters National Historic Site. Search the index below for specific topics, or browse through individual issues of the Bulletin by clicking on the thumbnail images or text links below.             Longfellow House Bulletin Index (.pdf file, 245 KB) The Longfellow House Bulletin Index currently contains information on all editions up to vol. 14, no. 2, the December, 2010 issue. You can search the index by simply browsing, or locate specific names and terms by using the search function embedded within the PDF file.             Vol. 16, No. 1 June, 2012 (.pdf file, 572 KB) All about the Craigies! Andrew and Elizabeth Craigie and the house, and the Craigies in Cambridge. Society of the Cincinnati at the house.            Vol. 15, No.2 December, 2011 (.pdf file, 883 KB) Special double issue commemorating the 150th anniversary of the Civil War. The Longfellow family, Cambridge, and the Civil War.            Vol. 15, No. 1 June, 2011 (.pdf file, 673 KB) Official name change for the site, and the names of the house through the years.            Vol. 14, No. 2 December, 2010 (.pdf file, 532 KB) Celebrating the 200th birthday of Charles Sumner, Massachusetts senator, abolitionist, and friend of Henry W. Longfellow. Interview with Beverly Morgan-Welch.            Vol.14, No. 1 June, 2010 (.pdf file, 754 KB) Connections between the Longfellow House and Southeast Asia. Charley Longfellow's visit to Vietnam and Siam (Thailand) and the historic photos he brought back. The King of Thailand's connections to Cambridge.           Vol. 13, No. 2 December, 2009 (.pdf file, 3.48 MB) New research on Longfellow's poem "Paul Revere's Ride". Remembering Senator Ted Kennedy. Interview with Charles Bahne, public historian.           Vol. 13, No. 1 June, 2009 (.pdf file, 577 KB) Longfellow family pets, George Washington's dogs, interview with Susan Moynihan, student poetry awards.           Vol. 12, No. 2 December, 2008 (.pdf file, 522 KB) Harvard and Smithsonian classes at the Longfellow House, Georgian houses in and around Cambridge, interview with Laurel Thatcher Ulrich.           Vol. 12, No. 1 June, 2008 (.pdf file, 411 KB) The Longfellow family and historic preservation. William Sumner Appleton, founder of the Society for the Preservation of New England Antiquities. Interview with Boston University professor Melanie Hall.           Vol. 11, No. 2 December, 2007 (.pdf file, 381 KB) The history, organization, contents, and present-day use of the House archives. Interview with NPS Chief Curator Ann Hitchcock.            Vol. 11, No. 1 June, 2007 (.pdf file, 490 KB) Henry Wadsworth Longfellow's bicentennial, with a look back at his 1907 centennial celebration.  Interview with poet and NEA chairman Dana Gioia.           Vol. 10, No. 2 December, 2006 (.pdf file, 252 KB) Longfellow House selected as part of the National Park Service's Underground Railroad Network to Freedom.  Longfellow and Slavery.  Gearing up for Longfellow's 200th birthday.           Vol. 10, No. 1 June, 2006 (.pdf file, 376 KB) Reverend Samuel Longfellow - Unitarian reformer, the poet's younger brother.           Vol. 9, No. 2 December, 2005 (.pdf file, 416 KB) Children in the house, then and now.  Christoph Irmscher's new book Longfellow Redux.           Vol. 9, No. 1 June, 2005 (.pdf file, 593 KB) Longfellow Garden Project Issue:  Contains information about the progress of the capital campaign and the initial plantings as of Spring, 2005.           Vol. 8, No. 2 December, 2004 (.pdf file, 477 KB) Charley Longfellow's collection of Japanese art and furnishings. The Thorp collection of glass-plate negatives. The Longfellows as collectors.           Vol. 8, No. 1 June, 2004 (.pdf file, 404 KB) A new biography of Longfellow.  The Longfellow family and education.  Harry Dana's early 20th century Russian photographs.           Vol. 7, No. 2 December, 2003 (.pdf file, 541 KB) Longfellow the translator, Longfellow in translation.  Charley Longfellow's "Japanese Room".  Interview with the archivist.           Vol. 7, No. 1 June, 2003 (.pdf file, 437 KB) New research on the pre-Longfellow occupants.  The Vassalls, black and white, Vassalls and New England slavery, and George Washington's changing views on black soldiers in the army during the Revolution.           Vol. 6, No. 2 December, 2002 (.pdf file, 471 KB) Longfellow and Dante.  Over 400 historic glass-plate negatives donated to archives.           Vol. 6, No. 1 June, 2002 (.pdf file, 364 KB) The Longfellow House reopens after a three year rehabilitation project!  Preservation history of the house.  Also, Longfellow and music.           Vol. 5, No. 2 December, 2001 (.pdf file, 358 KB) "A House May Hold a World", and archeological findings.           Vol. 5, No. 1 June, 2001 (.pdf file, 749 KB) Double issue!  Considerations and reconsiderations of The Song of Hiawatha.           Vol. 4, No. 2 December, 2000 (.pdf file, 381 KB) The Longfellow House's Brazilian connection, and Samuel Longfellow's stay in the Azores.           Vol. 4, No. 1 June, 2000 (.pdf file, 676 KB) Double issue!  George Washington's residency, 225 years ago.  Phillis Wheatley's poem for Washington in Cambridge, and Longfellow's homage to Washington.  Dana papers cataloged.           Vol. 3, No. 2 December, 1999 (.pdf file, 503 KB) Replicas of the Longfellow House across the country.  Henry Wadsworth Longfellow Dana's finding aid published by the Longfellow House archives.           Vol. 3, No. 1 June, 1999 (.pdf file, 380 KB) George and Martha Washington at the Longfellow House, and a visit from Hillary Clinton.           Vol. 2, No. 2 December, 1998 (.pdf file, 333 KB) Nineteenth century women artists at the Longfellow House.           Vol. 2, No. 1 June, 1998 (.pdf file, 491 KB) A Laura Bridgman poem comes to light.  Information on the Longfellow House's photographic collection and Scandinavian collection.           Vol. 1, No. 3 December, 1997 (.pdf file, 518 KB) Alice Longfellow's garden, and archeological findings at the site.           Vol. 1, No. 2 June, 1997 (.pdf file, 432 KB) A look at the Longfellow House archives.  Charles Longfellow's years in Meiji Japan.  Alice Longfellow as preservationist at both the Longfellow House and Mt. Vernon.           Vol. 1, No. 1 December, 1996 (.pdf file, 252 KB) Founding of the Friends of the Longfellow House, and the first issue of the Longfellow House Bulletin.
